event description: Following political unrest in Ukraine, Russia annexed Crimea after a controversial referendum, escalating tensions with Ukraine and Western nations. The international community condemned the annexation as illegal.
Armed separatist movements emerged in Eastern Ukraine, sparking prolonged conflict. Russia supported separatist factions, causing significant human and economic losses.
Ceasefire agreement signed in Minsk to halt fighting in Eastern Ukraine, frequently broken, with conflict persisting.
Updated ceasefire and resolution framework signed, but full implementation remained elusive.

insight: Volodymyr Zelensky becomes President of Ukraine
event description: Zelensky inaugurated as president, pledging reforms and EU/NATO integration.

insight: Russia amasses troops near Ukrainian border
event description: Significant Russian military buildup near Ukraine's borders prompted invasion fears.

insight: Russia demands NATO guarantees on Ukraine
event description: Russia demanded NATO halt eastward expansion, specifically barring Ukraineâ€™s membership.

insight: U.S. warns Ukraine of imminent invasion
event description: U.S. intelligence indicated imminent Russian invasion, prompting urgent diplomatic and military aid to Ukraine.

insight: Russia recognizes Donetsk and Luhansk separatist republics
event description: Russia formally recognized separatist-held areas, effectively ending Minsk agreements.
Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine, escalating conflict significantly.

insight: Russia annexes occupied territories in Ukraine
event description: Russia announced annexation of Ukrainian regions partially under its military control after disputed referendums, condemned internationally.
